name: Automate Weekly Tech Research with Perplexity AI, Notion & Gmail

parameters.content:
## ⏰ Report Scheduling














Set the time when your monitoring workflow will run automatically.

👉 Currently, the trigger is configured to launch the monitoring every Monday at 9 AM.

## 🤖 Monitoring AI Agent



















This is where you define your agent's system prompt.

👉 Adjust its goals, roles, and behavior based on your desired monitoring strategy.

## 🧠 Language Model

















Define the language model your agent will use here.

👉 In this example, OpenRouter is connected with the DeepSeek (Perplexity Sonar DeepSearch) model to perform advanced and accurate research.

You only need to connect your own AI credits (OpenAI, Mistral, etc.).  
➡️ Perplexity is highly recommended for monitoring and research tasks.

## 🗂️ Database Selection



















Select the database where the results of your weekly monitoring will be automatically stored.

👉 In this example, Notion is connected: new entries are added or updated automatically.

parameters.text:
/<task>  
Conduct a technology watch on recent and innovative artificial intelligence tools.  
You must research, identify, and present a selection of tools that have been launched or have gained popularity in the past 3 months.  
The goal is to discover useful, lesser-known solutions with high potential for professionals and businesses.  
</task>

/<sources>  
Include https://theresanaiforthat.com/ as **one** of the possible sources.  
You are also required to explore other reliable sources: specialized AI blogs, press releases, tech forums, product launch platforms, no-code communities.  
</sources>

/<guidelines>  
1. Exclude already well-known tools (e.g., ChatGPT, Midjourney, Notion AI, etc.).  
2. Focus on tools for professional use: automation, productivity, analytics, content generation.  
3. Favor tools that are no-code or easy to use by non-technical teams.  
4. Prioritize tools that are publicly available and active (no early-stage concepts or closed prototypes).  
5. Provide up-to-date results, specifically from the last 3 months.  
</guidelines>

/<output-format>  
For each selected tool, provide:  
- Tool name  
- Official link or presentation page  
- Clear summary of how it works (2 to 4 lines max)  
- 1 or 2 concrete examples of professional use  
- What makes the tool stand out and its main benefits  
- Specify whether the information comes from theresanaiforthat.com or another verified source  
</output-format>

/<volume>  
Limit to **10 tools maximum**, selected for their relevance and added value.  
Quality > Quantity.  
</volume>

/<language>  
All results must be written in English, even if the tools or sources are in another language.  
</language>

parameters.description:
### 🧠 Tool: Think (Internal Reflection)

Use this tool when the agent needs to **think internally**, without performing any actions or querying external sources.  
It does **not retrieve any new information** and does **not modify any database** — it simply **adds a thought to the internal log**.

🛠 Recommended for:
- Complex reasoning steps  
- Internal decision-making  
- Managing short-term memory between actions

parameters.content:
## 🧩 Internal Thinking Tool











This node allows the agent to express a thought without interacting with external sources or modifying the database.

👉 Use it when the agent needs to structure a thought, engage short-term memory, or perform complex reasoning.

## 📬 Automatic Report Delivery
















This module handles the email sending of the generated monitoring results.

👉 The report is automatically sent to the configured recipients once the monitoring is complete.
